item.title: Blackhawks' Nordstrom faces Player Safety hearing
item.description:
Chicago Blackhawks forward Joakim Nordstrom will have a hearing Friday with the NHL Department for Player Safety for boarding Arizona Coyotes defenseman Oliver Ekman-Larsson during a game at Gila River Arena on Thursday.
Ekman-Larsson was hit b...

item.title: Jets defenseman Ellerby recalled from AHL
item.description:
The Winnipeg Jets announced they have recalled defenseman Keaton Ellerby from the St. John's IceCaps of the American Hockey League.
Ellerby, 26, has played in 41 games this season with the IceCaps collecting 16 points and 32 penalty minutes. Th...

item.title: Bruins sign forward Vatrano to entry-level contract
item.description:
Boston, MA - Boston Bruins General Manager Peter Chiarelli announced today, March 13, that the club has signed UMass-Amherst forward Frank Vatrano to an entry-level contract. Vatrano will report to the Providence Bruins.
Vatrano finished up his...

item.title: Otters winger Alex Debrincat making a name for himself in rookie season
item.description:
Alex Debrincat was passed over twice in the OHL draft before joining the Erie Otters as a free agent last spring.
He's made the teams who decided not to take a chance on him regret it.
The five-foot-seven 160-pound American is the top-scor...

item.title: Goalie Price drawing Hart Trophy attention as low-scoring Canadiens rise to top
item.description:
MONTREAL - Even those reluctant to give goaltenders their vote for the Hart Trophy are having to reconsider with the season Carey Price is having for the Montreal Canadiens.
Some coaches, including Washington's Barry Trotz and Florida's Gerar...

item.title: Richards, Shaw score power-play goals in Blackhawks' 2-1 win over Coyotes
item.description:
GLENDALE, Ariz. - Brad Richards scored a tiebreaking power-play goal with 7:11 left in the third period to give the Chicago Blackhawks a 2-1 win over the Arizona Coyotes on Thursday night.

item.title: Elliott earns shutout, then picks up win in shootout as Blues edge Flyers
item.description:
ST. LOUIS - Brian Elliott didn't want to blink.
The St. Louis goalie and Steve Mason, his Philadelphia counterpart, both earned shutouts on Thursday night. Elliott also came away with a win as the host Blues edged the Flyers 1-0 in a shootout...

item.title: Thursday's NHL Capsules
item.description:
BOSTON - Patrice Bergeron and Brad Marchand scored shootout goals to lift the Boston Bruins to a 3-2 victory over the Tampa Bay Lightning on Thursday night.

item.title: Semyon Varlamov back to full health, leads Avalanche to 2-1 shootout win over Devils
item.description:
DENVER - Jarome Iginla scored in the second period and got the decisive goal in the shootout, Semyon Varlamov stopped 23 shots and the Colorado Avalanche beat the New Jersey Devils 2-1 on Thursday night.
The Avs are now 1-1 on a pivotal three...

item.title: Elliott earns shutout, then picks up win in shootout as Blues edge Flyers
item.description:
ST. LOUIS - Columbus' Brian Elliott and Philadelphia's Steve Mason both earned shutouts, but Elliott picked up the win in a shootout as the host Blues edged the Flyers 1-0 on Thursday night.

item.description:

item.title: Erik Karlsson scores twice as red-hot Senators down Canadiens 5-2
item.description:

item.title: Penguins squander huge lead, recover late for 6-4 win over sagging Edmonton
item.description:

item.title: Goligoski, Eakin, and Eaves have goal and assist each in Stars' 5-3 win over Hurricanes
item.description:
RALEIGH, N.C. - Alex Goligoski, Cody Eakin and Patrick Eaves each had a goal and an assist, sparking the Dallas Stars to a 5-3 victory over the Carolina Hurricanes on Thursday night.

item.description:

item.title: Montreal, Winnipeg moving AHL franchises, OHL team headed to Hamilton
item.description:
The Montreal Canadiens and Winnipeg Jets are moving their American Hockey League affiliates and the Ontario Hockey League's Belleville Bulls will play in Hamilton, Ontario, next season.
Montreal is shifting its AHL team from Hamilton to St. J...

item.title: Rangers' Klein out 3-4 weeks with upper-body injury
item.description:
New York Rangers defenseman Kevin Klein will miss 3-4 weeks because of an upper-body injury, the Rangers announced Thursday.
Klein, who sustained the injury blocking a shot by Alex Ovechkin on Wednesday in a 3-1 win against the Washington Capit...

item.title: Anaheim Ducks send Josh Manson to minors with Vatanen, Beleskey nearing returns from injury
item.description:
ANAHEIM, Calif. - The Anaheim Ducks have reassigned defenceman Josh Manson to the minors with Matt Beleskey and Sami Vatanen nearing return from injury.
The Ducks announced the move Thursday.
Manson has three assists in 28 games with Anahe...

item.title: Sharks' Torres hopes to continue career after surgery
item.description:
SAN JOSE -- San Jose Sharks forward Raffi Torres, two weeks removed from the third major right-knee surgery of his career, said he's encouraged he'll be able to return to the NHL next season.
"Yeah, big-time," Torres said. "I've had a chance to...

item.title: OHL approves relocation and ownership transfer of Belleville Bulls to Hamilton
item.description:
TORONTO - The Belleville Bulls will be moving to Steeltown later this year.
The Ontario Hockey League's Board of Governors approved the relocation of the franchise to Hamilton starting in the 2015-'16 season, the OHL said Thursday in a releas...

item.title: Canadiens, Jets moving AHL teams next season
item.description:
The American Hockey League announced Thursday that Montreal Canadiens ownership, Club de Hockey Canadien Inc., acquired and then relocated the Hamilton Bulldogs to St. John's and will begin play there in the 2015-16 season.

item.title: Islanders' Boychuk agrees to terms on new contract
item.description:
The New York Islanders announced Thursday that defenseman Johnny Boychuk has agreed to terms on a seven-year contract.
Financial details of the contract were not released, but Newsday reported it's worth $42 million, for a $6 million annual ave...

item.title: Flyers sign forward Bardreau to entry-level contract
item.description:
The Philadelphia Flyers have signed forward Cole Bardreau to a three-year entry-level contract beginning with the start of the 2015-16 season, according to general manager Ron Hextall.
Bardreau, 21, recently completed a four-year career at Cor...

item.title: Columbus Blue Jackets activate defenceman Ryan Murray after missing 5 weeks with ankle sprain
item.description:
COLUMBUS, Ohio - The Columbus Blue Jackets have activated defenceman Ryan Murray off injured reserve after he missed five weeks with a high ankle sprain.
Murray was hurt in a game against St. Louis on Feb. 6.
The 21-year-old picked No. 2 o...

item.title: Parenteau returns to Canadiens lineup after agent tweets: Therrien says timing right
item.description:

item.title: Rangers' Klein to meet with doctor after shot block
item.description:
New York Rangers defenseman Kevin Klein has returned to New York to meet with a team physician after blocking a shot Wednesday against the Washington Capitals, the Rangers announced Thursday.

item.title: Maple Leafs recall defenseman Brennan from AHL
item.description:

item.title: Islanders' Leddy will miss at least two weeks: report
item.description:
New York Islanders defenseman Nick Leddy will be out at least two weeks because of an upper-body injury, according to Newsday.

item.title: WHL Roundup: Bjorkstrand, Henry lead Winterhawks over Silvertips
item.description:

item.description:
